Television

Timeline

The Very Incomplete History of Jimmy

  • 1993-1998

    James Madison University

    Major-hopping from music, to Architecture, to Set Design, to Stage Management.

  • 1998-2000

    The New York Years, Part 1

    Production manager for Studio Designs, one of New York's largest event design firms. Clients included Macy's, Gerorge Soros, some Kennedy's, the International Monetary Fund, the Democratic and Republican parties, the World Bank, and more.

  • 2000-2004

    The Tour Years

    As a union stagehand, toured with Broadway productions of Annie, Jekyll & Hyde, Cinderella, Cabaret, Seussical the Musical, Peter Pan, Dr. Dolittle, Movin' Out, Bombay Dreams, High School Musical 2, and more.

  • 2004-2014

    The New York Years, Part 2 - The Television Years

    Trading Spaces, Town Haul, Don't Sweat It, Dear Genevieve, Mom Caves, BUILT, Construction Cash, Closet Cases, and more. Lead carpenter, co-host, and project manager for hundreds of episodes of home-makeover TV.

  • 2014 and Beyond

    The LA Years

    Now living in LA and working at the Disney/ABC Television Group. Helping the Mouse House put entertainment in your pocket.

-->

Contact Me

Shoot me an email. I like people.

Your email address is only used to respond to you. It's not kept in any database, sold to anybody else, or used to send you stupid newsletters.

Disney | ABC

As a specialist at DATG, I help to put all the videos, images, and slideshows in to the streaming media apps for ABC, Freeform, Disney, Disney XD, and Disney Junior. I also deal with onboarding new cable companies and troubleshooting issues with our CMSes.

  • Client: Disney
  • Date: 2014
  • What I Did: Specialist

Bug Dog Studios

Bug Dog Studios, LLC was a custom cabinet and furniure shop based in Brooklyn, NY

  • Client: NYC Apartment Owners
  • Date: 2012
  • What I Did: Owner

Dear Genevieve

Genevieve Gorder hosts this design-focused makeover show that allowed me to exercise my own design chops with furniture and built-ins that most people would kill a hobo to get.

  • Client: HGTV
  • Date: 2008
  • What I Did: Co-host, Carpenter, Project Manager

Bug Dog Studios

Bug Dog Studios was a short-lived podcast network I did for fun. There were two shows, "We Only Talk About Everything", where we talked about, well, everything; and "Movie Mandates", a show where 2 guys show a movie to a third guy who's never seen it.

  • Client: Start Bootstrap
  • Date: 2009
  • What I Did: Host

Don't Sweat It

Lighting fast makeovers were the specialty of Don't Sweat It. Two days from the time we drove up to the time we drove away. Full bathroom or Kitchen in two days? Sure, why the hell not. We were the first show to be "bleeped" on HGTV, so I'm pretty proud of that.

  • Client: HGTV
  • Date: 2005
  • What I Did: Co-host, Carpenter, Project Manager
  • Run: 120 episodes over 9 seasons

Trading Spaces

I was the east coast carpenter for Trading Spaces for the two seasons they decided do the show with no host and only one carpenter. As the only person allowed to enter both houses, I acted as a pseudo-host at times.

  • Client: TLC
  • Date: 2004
  • What I Did: Co-host and Carpenter
  • Run: 12 episodes over 2 seasons

Town Haul

Town Haul didn't last long, but we had a great time. This was my first foray into television, and I still think back on those 20 hour days fondly.

  • Client: TLC
  • Date: 2003
  • What I Did: Co-host and Project Manager
  • Run: 18 episodes over 3 seasons

The Touring Years

Touring with Broadway shows is a sometimes-full-time gig that I've been doing off and on for over 15 years. The list is varied. Annie, Jekyll & Hyde, Cinderella, Cabaret, Seussical The Musical, Bombay Dreams, Movin' Out, High School Musical 2, Dr. Dolittle, Peter Pan. | I've also worked on a few shows that didn't tour... The Pirate Queen, Tarzan, Carrie, Footloose, Anything Goes. | My favorite shows to do are the shows where I'm a flyguy. Seussical, Dolittle, Tarzan, Carrie, The Pirate Queen, and Peter Pan.

  • Client: Theater Goers
  • Date: 2000
  • What I Did: Head Carpenter, Production Manager, FlyGuy
